ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You have to take this if you're a CS major... pretty wierd if you took it otherwise.

Its required obviously but if done right 490 is also an awesome experience. I learned a ton and got to focus on topics I was specifically interested in. Make sure you don't save the work til the end of the semester. If you get into a groove where you work maybe 10-20 hours a week on the project and you stay in that groove, its way easier to keep up and do a good job.

There couldn't be a better course - you just choose something cool to look at and study it all semester long. Really gratifying and I learned a ton. Just make sure you choose a topic that you're actually interested in, which means you should start thinking about options/advisors early (over break).

I think the senior project is a great requirement for the CS major. It really gives students a chance to do individual research and get a sense for whether they want to pursue research further (such as in grad school). One thing I regret is not having spent more time before this semester thinking about and picking out a senior project that really interested me. Since I didn't have any project ideas, I went to Professor Abadi and asked him if he had any project ideas. He shared some with me and I picked one that sounded interesting. My semester turned out to be a lot busier than I expected, and I kind of put off my project. I ended up working on the project 20 days past the end-of-reading-week deadline. I would highly recommend picking a project that you really want to work on and then scheduling some set hours each week where you will work on the project. It is also a good idea to set some milestones for yourself, or else it is very easy to end up doing everything at the end of the semester, like I did. Looking back, I wish I did a project involving the StarCraft Brood War API: http://code.google.com/p/bwapi/. If you're into StarCraft, I think this would be very very cool, and you could try out some AI algorithms.
